p: The mechanism of action of flaxseed in stimulating fecal output during constipation clearly lies largely with its high fiber content. It is not surprising, therefore, that even partially defatted flaxseed meal was a valuable laxative in both normal and constipated condition [ 78]. However, flaxseed oil has been shown to act on intestinal muscarinic receptors and blocks K+ channels [ 77], actions that would both lead to modifications of intestinal motility.
